content.question_text:
A water tank has been fitted with two taps P and Q and a drain pipe R. Taps P and Q fill at the rate of 12 litres per minute and 10 litres per minute respectively.
Consider the following statements S1, S2 and S3 :
S1 : Pipe R drains out at the rate of 6 litres per minute.
S2 : If both the taps and the drain pipe are opened simultaneously, then the tank is filled in 5 hours 45 minutes.
S3 : Pipe R drains out (fully) the filled tank in 15 hours 20 minutes.
To know what is the capacity of the tank, which one of the following is correct ?
content.equation_data:
A water tank has been fitted with two taps P and Q and a drain pipe R. Taps P and Q fill at the rate of 12 litres per minute and 10 litres per minute respectively.
Consider the following statements S1, S2 and S3 :
S1 : Pipe R drains out at the rate of 6 litres per minute.
S2 : If both the taps and the drain pipe are opened simultaneously, then the tank is filled in 5 hours 45 minutes.
S3 : Pipe R drains out (fully) the filled tank in 15 hours 20 minutes.
To know what is the capacity of the tank, which one of the following is correct ?

options.text: S1, S2 and S3 are necessary
options.equation_data: S1, S2 and S3 are necessary

options.text: Any two out of S1, S2 and S3 are sufficient
options.equation_data: Any two out of S1, S2 and S3 are sufficient

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Any two out of S1, S2 and S3 are sufficient

content.question_text:
Consider the following statements : Two triangles are said to be congruent, if
1. Three angles of one triangle are equal to the corresponding three angles of the other triangle.
2. Three sides of one triangle are equal to the corresponding three sides of the other triangle,
3. Two sides and the included angle of one triangle are equal to the corresponding two sides and the included angle of the other triangle.
4. Two angles and the included side of one triangle are equal to the corresponding two angles and the included side of the other triangle.
Which of the above statements are correct ?
content.equation_data:
Consider the following statements : Two triangles are said to be congruent, if

2. Three sides of one triangle are equal to the corresponding three sides of the other triangle,
3. Two sides and the included angle of one triangle are equal to the corresponding two sides and the included angle of the other triangle.
4. Two angles and the included side of one triangle are equal to the corresponding two angles and the included side of the other triangle.
Which of the above statements are correct ?

content.question_text:
Given that the angles of a polygon are all equal and each angle is a right angle.
Statement-1: The polygon has exactly four sides.
Statement-2: The sum of the angles of a polygon having n sides is (3n - 8) right angles.
Which one of the following is correct in respect of the above statements ?
content.equation_data:
Given that the angles of a polygon are all equal and each angle is a right angle.
Statement-1: The polygon has exactly four sides.
Statement-2: The sum of the angles of a polygon having n sides is (3n - 8) right angles.
Which one of the following is correct in respect of the above statements ?

options.text: Both Statement-1 and Statement-2 are true and Statement-2 is the correct explanation of Statement-1
options.equation_data: Both Statement-1 and Statement-2 are true and Statement-2 is the correct explanation of Statement-1

options.text: Both Statement-1 and Statement-2 are true but Statement-2 is not the correct explanation of Statement-1
options.equation_data: Both Statement-1 and Statement-2 are true but Statement-2 is not the correct explanation of Statement-1

options.text: Statement-1 is true but Statement-2 is false
options.equation_data: Statement-1 is true but Statement-2 is false

options.text: Statement-1 is false but Statement-2 is true
options.equation_data: Statement-1 is false but Statement-2 is true

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Statement-1 is true but Statement-2 is false
